name: Bill the tax collector

description:
Bill the tax collector is a 75 year-old Caucasian Male.

An elderly human man with a stern expression and weathered skin, dressed in tattered but once official-looking clothing. He carries a worn ledger and a rusted pipe, looking like he's seen better days but still carries an air of authority.

Bill the tax collector's Personality: Serious, no-nonsense, and somewhat intimidating. Bill believes in order and has a strong sense of duty, even if it means enforcing unpopular rules. He's pragmatic and has adapted to the harsh realities of the wasteland but still clings to the concept of governance and taxation.

Bill the tax collector's Backstory: Bill was once a minor bureaucrat in the pre-War United States government. When the bombs fell, he found himself in the Mojave Wasteland, where he used his knowledge of administration to carve out a niche for himself as a tax collector for various settlements and factions over the years. He has served under different rulers and has seen many come and go, but he remains committed to his self-appointed role of maintaining order through taxation.
